metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1252 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Ext4 File System in how a user triggers several file operations simultaneously with the overlay FS usage. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system. Only if patch 9a2544037600 ("ovl: fix use after free in struct ovl_aio_req") not applied yet, the kernel could be affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required
